# Technology-poweredinvestment firm 
## Specializing in alternative assets
[Learn More](https://www.legalist.com/<#about-section>)[Explore Offerings](https://www.legalist.com/<#offerings-section>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6231fa20fd026f7ed6c3eb2b/623521722e824184b97d0a9c_Chevron%20Down.svg)
## About Us
Founded in 2016 and incubated at Y Combinator, Legalist launched its first fund in 2017. Today, Legalist manages over $1 billion in technology-enabled alternative investments for endowments, foundations, hospitals, insurance companies, and family offices.
[Explore](https://www.legalist.com/</about>)
## What We Do
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6231fa20fd026f7ed6c3eb2b/623dd0472079a1db278f4082_techlight2.svg)
Tech-based origination at scale in alternative assets
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6231fa20fd026f7ed6c3eb2b/623dd0471d66572deafb28b0_mllight2.svg)
Artificial intelligence to identify investments from public datasets
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6231fa20fd026f7ed6c3eb2b/623dd04831ff2d38a3117ff5_yieldlight2.svg)
Uncorrelated yield for institutional investors

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Legalist**

Legalist is a tech-enabled asset management firm based in San Francisco, specializing in alternative investments. Founded in 2016 and part of Y Combinator's Summer 2016 batch, the company initially focused on esoteric private credit assets specifically in litigation and bankruptcy. Since launching its first fund in 2017, Legalist has grown to manage over $1 billion in technology-driven alternative investments, which cater to endowments, foundations, hospitals, insurance companies, and family offices.

**Mission and Focus Areas**

Legalist's mission revolves around leveraging technology to enhance asset management processes. They apply artificial intelligence to sift through vast public datasets, identifying investment opportunities that are typically overlooked. Their core strategies include:

- **Litigation Finance**: Providing funding for legal cases in exchange for a portion of the settlement.
- **Bankruptcy**: Investing in distressed assets that emerge during bankruptcies.
- **Government Receivables**: Securing investments based on anticipated payments from government entities.

**Team and Leadership**

The Legalist team comprises approximately 40 dedicated employees, with leadership from co-founders Christian Haigh and Eva Shang, both serving as General Partners. Their background in finance and technology equips the firm to navigate the complex landscape of alternative asset management. 

**Why Legalist Stands Out**

The unique blend of legal acumen and tech innovation positions Legalist at the intersection of fintech and legaltech. Their systematic approach not only seeks uncorrelated yield for institutional investors but also offers scalability in sourcing alternative asset investments.

For more information about their offerings or to explore potential partnerships, you can visit their website at [Legalist](https://www.legalist.com).

**Tags**: fintech, legaltech, San Francisco Bay Area.
